intro: Telephium imperati var. pauciflorum, commonly known as the meadow cinquefoil, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are heart-shaped with a hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
